intro: Neonauclea calcarea, commonly known as the limestone holly or rock holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a leathery texture. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Neonauclea calcarea thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
